pyhelper.gamehelpers.pghelper.widgets

Widgets ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This module provides a number of efficient Pygame GUI components that help you develop Pygame games. This module has the following classes: Animate: An animation class based on a series of loaded images TextButton: a _button created from text; no image can be specified CustomButton: A _button created from an image CheckBox: A checkbox created from an image Dragger: An image that you can drag around Image: An image that can be modified InputText: An input field for the user to enter RadioButtons: A set of radio boxes based on checkboxes All classes ending in Config are configuration classes, which correspond to the first argument of each component class. All Config classes take screen as their first parameter and also have a property called screen, which is the Surface of the scene to be drawn All Config classes have a set_config method that allows you to set a property using the format 'instance.set_config ( property name as a string, value to set)', which will raise a ValueError if it doesn't exist All components should be created and called in the standard Pygame manner.The basic usage is as follows: It is first created after setting up all components before the main loop starts The main loop then starts Draws the lowest level background image or background color Start checking for all events.If the component's update method requires an event parameter, it needs to be called when checking for events. After checking the event, intervene and execute for the state of all components and be prepared Then, the update() method is called for the other components to update the screen Next, the component is drawn by calling the draw() method Finally, we refresh the screen using pghelper.display.update(). See the Pyhelper documentation for detailed usage of all components: Or a docstring for the corresponding component class

  24"""
  25Widgets
  26~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  27This module provides a number of efficient Pygame GUI components that help you develop Pygame games.
  28This module has the following classes:
  29Animate: An animation class based on a series of loaded images
  30TextButton: a _button created from text; no image can be specified
  31CustomButton: A _button created from an image
  32CheckBox: A checkbox created from an image
  33Dragger: An image that you can drag around
  34Image: An image that can be modified
  35InputText: An input field for the user to enter
  36RadioButtons: A set of radio boxes based on checkboxes
  37All classes ending in Config are configuration classes, which correspond to the first argument of each component class.
  38All Config classes take screen as their first parameter and also have a property called screen, which is the Surface
  39of the scene to be drawn
  40All Config classes have a set_config method that allows you to set a property using the format 'instance.set_config (
  41property name as a string, value to set)', which will raise a ValueError if it doesn't exist
  42All components should be created and called in the standard Pygame manner.The basic usage is as follows:
  43It is first created after setting up all components before the main loop starts
  44The main loop then starts
  45Draws the lowest level background image or background color
  46Start checking for all events.If the component's update method requires an event parameter, it needs to be called
  47when checking for events.
  48After checking the event, intervene and execute for the state of all components and be prepared
  49Then, the update() method is called for the other components to update the screen
  50Next, the component is drawn by calling the draw() method
  51Finally, we refresh the screen using pghelper.display.update().
  52See the Pyhelper documentation for detailed usage of all components:
  53Or a docstring for the corresponding component class
  54"""
  55import os
  56import sys
  57import time
  58from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
  59from typing import *
  60
  61import pygame
  62
  63from pyhelper.gamehelpers.pghelper import load_images
  64
  65Color = Tuple[int, int, int]
  66Screen = pygame.Surface
  67Position = Tuple[int, int]
  68Path = str
  69Degree = px = int
  70

  73    "AnimateConfig",

  96# @!---------------------Config-------------------------------!@#
  97class BaseConfig(ABC):
  98    """
  99    This is the base class for all configuration classes and is also a private abstract class.
 100    This class should not be accessed, it is not an interface, but an implementation.
 101    """
 102
 103    @abstractmethod
 104    def __init__(self, screen: Screen):
 105        self.screen = screen
 106
 107    def set_config(self, config_name, value):
 108        """This method is used to configure the individual options"""
 109        if hasattr(self, config_name):
 110            setattr(self, config_name, value)
 111        else:
 112            raise ValueError(f"The {self.__class__.__name__} did not have attribute '{config_name}'")
 113
 114
 115class AnimateConfig(BaseConfig):
 116    """
 117    This is the configuration class for the Animate class.
 118    This class requires a set of images in addition to the basic screen parameter, as described in the images property
 119    It includes the following configuration options
 120
 121    Attributes:
 122        - images (tuple): This property can be a set of image paths to animate or a set of loaded image objects. If you
 123         need to animate as a Sprite, use the pghelper.disassemble_sprite_sheet() function
 124        - autostart (bool): This property indicates if the animation will start automatically and defaults to False
 125        - show_first_image_at_end(bool): This property is a Boolean indicating whether to show the first image after the
 126         animation is playing.It defaults to True
 127        - loop (bool): This property is a Boolean indicating whether the animation should loop indefinitely and defaults to
 128         False
 129        - nloop (int): This property specifies how many times the animation should loop and defaults to 1
 130        - duration(int): This property specifies that the image is switched every few Seconds
 131    """
 132
 133    def __init__(self, screen, images):
 134        super().__init__(screen)
 135        if isinstance(images[0], str):
 136            self.images = load_images(images)
 137        else:
 138            self.images = images
 139        self.autostart = False
 140        self.show_first_image_at_end = True
 141        self.loop = False
 142        self.nloop = 1
 143        self.duration = 0.1
 144
 145
 146class CustomButtonConfig(BaseConfig):
 147    """
 148    This is the configuration class for the CustomButton class. It includes the following configuration options
 149    In addition to the basic screen parameter, this class also requires the image_paths parameter, as described in
 150    the description of the image_paths property
 151    Attributes:
 152        - image_paths: This is a tuple of paths for all images, which should be passed in "release state, hold state, hover
 153         state, lock state". If any of the last three are specified, it is automatically set to the first
 154        - sounds_on_chick: This is the sound effect that was played when the _button was clicked and is a string pointing to
 155         the sound effect location. The default is None, which means no sound effect will be played.
 156        - command: is what needs to be done when the _button is pressed, is of type Function, defaults to None, i.e.,
 157         does nothing.
 158        - args: This is a tuple containing all the arguments of the command function
 159    """
 160
 161    def __init__(self, screen: pygame.SurfaceType, images: Union[list, tuple]):
 162        super().__init__(screen)
 163        if not isinstance(images, list):
 164            images = list(images)
 165        self.text_color: Union[list, tuple] = [(255, 255, 255), (190, 190, 190)]
 166        self.text: str = ""
 167        self.font: Optional[pygame.font.FontType] = None
 168        self.font_size: int = 20
 169        self.images: list = images
 170        self.sounds_on_chick: Optional[pygame.mixer.SoundType] = None
 171        self.command: Optional[Callable] = None
 172        self.args: tuple = tuple()
 173
 174
 175class TextButtonConfig(BaseConfig):
 176    """
 177    This is the configuration class for the TextButton class. It includes the following configuration options
 178    Attributes:
 179        - width (int): The length of the _button
 180        - height (int): The height of the _button
 181        - text (str): The text on the _button
 182        - button_color (list): A list of _button colors whose four elements represent the colors of the following states:
 183         normal, pressed, suspended, and locked
 184        - text_color (list): This is a list of _button text colors, with four elements representing the colors of the
 185        following states: normal, pressed, suspended, locked
 186        - font (str): str representation of the text font
 187        - text_size (int): The size of the text
 188        - sounds_on_chick(str): This is the sound effect that was played when the _button was clicked and is a string
 189        pointing to the sound effect location. The default is None, which means no sound effect will be played.
 190        the center of the screen.
 191        - command(Callable): is what needs to be done when the _button is pressed, is of type Function, defaults to None,
 192        i.e., does nothing.
 193        - args(tuple): This is a tuple containing all the arguments of the command function.
 194    """
 195
 196    def __init__(self, screen: Screen):
 197        super().__init__(screen)
 198        self.width = 180
 199        self.height = 50
 200        self.text_color = [(255, 255, 255), (190, 190, 190)]
 201        self.font = None
 202        self.text_size = 20
 203        self.sounds_on_chick = None
 204        self.button_color = [(50, 205, 50), (50, 205, 50), (0, 255, 0), (169, 169, 169)]
 205        self.text = "Hello World!"
 206        self.command = None
 207        self.args = tuple()
 208

 210class CheckBoxConfig(BaseConfig):
 211    """
 212    This is the configuration class for the CheckBox class. It includes the following configuration options
 213    Attributes:
 214        - text (str): This is the text to display in the CheeckBox Default is 'CheckBox'.
 215        - font (str): This is the font name for the text property; the default font is used by default
 216        - image_path (str): This attribute is a tuple whose elements are unchecked, checked, locked to checked,
 217        and locked to the image in the checked state
 218        - text_color (tuple): This refers to the text new_color
 219    """
 220
 221    def __init__(self, screen):
 222        super().__init__(screen)
 223        self.text = "CheckBox"
 224        self.font = None
 225        self.image_paths = ("CheckBox",)
 226        self.text_color = (255, 255, 255)

 229class InputTextConfig(BaseConfig):
 230    """
 231    This is the configuration class for the CheckBox class. It includes the following configuration options
 232
 233    Attributes:
 234        -loc (tuple): This property indicates the initial top-left position of the text box component.It is represented by
 235         a tuple and defaults to (0, 0).
 236        -new_color (tuple): This property represents the background new_color of the text box.It is represented as an RGB
 237         tuple and defaults to (0, 0, 0).
 238        -text_color (tuple): This property is the new_color of the text in the text box.It is represented as an RGB tuple
 239         and defaults to (2255, 255, 255).
 240        -font (str): This property represents the name of the text font in string format and defaults to None, which is the
 241         system default font
 242        -value (str): This property represents the text in the initial state and defaults to.
 243        -width (int): This property is the length of the text box in pixels.It defaults to 250
 244        -font_size (int): This property represents the font size and also determines the height of the text box.It defaults
 245         to 30
 246        - focus_color(tuple): This property refers to the new_color of the outer border of the text box while it is
 247         selected, defaults to (0, 0, 0).
 248        -init_focus (bool): This property indicates whether the text box gets focus directly when initialized and defaults
 249         to False
 250        -mask (str): This property indicates the character in which the input should be rendered in the text field
 251         (* if it's a password field).It defaults to None, which means no mask is used
 252        - keep_focus_on_submit(bool): This property indicates whether to keep focus when the Enter or Return key is pressed
 253         in a text box. It defaults to False
 254        -command (function): This is the function you want to call when the Enter or Return key is pressed in the text box.
 255         It defaults to None, indicating that no function was called
 256        -args (tuple): This is a tuple representing the arguments of the command
 257    """
 258
 259    def __init__(self, screen):
 260        super().__init__(screen)
 261        self.loc = (0, 0)
 262        self.color = (255, 255, 255)
 263        self.text_color = (0, 0, 0)
 264        self.font = None
 265        self.value = ""
 266        self.width = 250
 267        self.font_size = 30
 268        self.command = None
 269        self.args = tuple
 270        self.focus_color = (0, 0, 0)
 271        self.init_focus = False
 272        self.mask = None
 273        self.keep_focus_on_submit = False
 274

 276# @!---------------------Widgets------------------------------!@#

 279class Animate:
 280    """An animation class based on a series of loaded images"""
 281
 282    def __init__(self, ac: AnimateConfig):
 283        self.screen = ac.screen
 284        self.images = []
 285        self.duration = ac.duration
 286        self.rect = []
 287        self._pause = False
 288        self.nimage = 0
 289        self.xloop = False
 290        self.elapsed = 0
 291        for image in ac.images:
 292            this_image = image
 293            this_rect = this_image.get_rect()
 294            self.rect.append(this_rect)
 295            self.images.append(this_image)
 296            self.nimage += 1
 297        self.loop = ac.loop
 298        self.nloop = ac.nloop
 299        self.start_time = 0
 300        self.show_first_image_at_end = ac.show_first_image_at_end
 301        self.playing = False
 302        self.index = 0
 303        if ac.autostart:
 304            self.play()
 305            self.update()
 306            self.draw()
 307
 308    def play(self):
 309        """Playing the animate"""
 310        self.playing = True
 311        if self._pause:
 312            self._pause = False
 313            return
 314        self.start_time = time.time()
 315        self.index = 0
 316
 317    def pause(self):
 318        """Pause the animate"""
 319        self._pause = True
 320
 321    def update(self):
 322        """Update the animate, Should be called from the main game loop"""
 323        if not self.playing or self._pause:
 324            return
 325
 326        self.elapsed = time.time() - self.start_time
 327        if self.elapsed > self.duration:
 328            self.index += 1
 329            if self.index >= self.nimage:
 330                self.nloop -= 1
 331                self.index = 1
 332                if self.nloop <= 0 and not self.loop:
 333                    self.playing = False
 334                    if self.show_first_image_at_end:
 335                        self.index = 0
 336                        self.draw()
 337            else:
 338                self.start_time = time.time()
 339
 340    def draw(self):
 341        """Draw the animate"""
 342        self.screen.blit(self.images[self.index], self.rect[self.index])
 343
 344
 345class CustomButton:
 346    """An image-based custom _button class"""
 347
 348    def __init__(self, bc: CustomButtonConfig):
 349        self.screen = bc.screen
 350        self.screen_rect = bc.screen.get_rect()
 351        self.__is_check_down = False
 352        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(bc.font, bc.font_size)
 353        self.text = bc.text
 354        self.command = bc.command
 355        self.args = bc.args
 356        self.text_color = bc.text_color
 357        self.sounds_on_chick = bc.sounds_on_chick
 358        self.up_image = bc.images[0]
 359        try:
 360            self.down_image = bc.images[1]
 361        except IndexError:
 362            self.down_image = bc.images[0]
 363        try:
 364            self.over_image = bc.images[2]
 365        except IndexError:
 366            self.over_image = bc.images[0]
 367        try:
 368            self.lock_image = bc.images[3]
 369        except IndexError:
 370            self.lock_image = bc.images[0]
 371        if isinstance(self.up_image, str):
 372            self.up_image = pygame.image.load(self.up_image).convert().convert_alpha()
 373        if isinstance(self.down_image, str):
 374            self.down_image = pygame.image.load(self.down_image).convert().convert_alpha()
 375        if isinstance(self.over_image, str):
 376            self.over_image = pygame.image.load(self.over_image).convert().convert_alpha()
 377        if isinstance(self.lock_image, str):
 378            self.lock_image = pygame.image.load(self.lock_image).convert().convert_alpha()
 379        self.image = self.up_image
 380        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 381        self.hidden = False
 382        self.lock = False
 383
 384    def is_chick(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 385        """
 386        Return Whether to click
 387
 388        Args:
 389            event: Events passed in the event loop
 390        """
 391        if self.hidden or self.lock:
 392            return False
 393        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
 394            return False
 395        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 396            return True
 397        return False
 398
 399    def _is_check_down(self, event):
 400        if not self.__is_check_down:
 401            return False
 402        if self.hidden or self.lock:
 403            return False
 404        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
 405            return False
 406        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 407            return True
 408        return False
 409
 410    def is_hover(self) -> bool:
 411        """Return Whether to hover"""
 412        if self.hidden or self.lock:
 413            return False
 414        if pygame.mouse.get_pressed()[0]:
 415            return False
 416        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 417            return True
 418        return False
 419
 420    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType):
 421        """
 422        Update the Button
 423
 424        Args:
 425            event: Events passed in the event loop
 426        """
 427        if self.hidden:
 428            return
 429        if self.lock:
 430            self.image = self.lock_image
 431        elif self._is_check_down(event):
 432            self.__is_check_down = True
 433            self.image = self.down_image
 434            if self.sounds_on_chick is not None:
 435                sound = pygame.mixer.Sound(self.sounds_on_chick)
 436                sound.play()
 437        elif self.is_chick(event):
 438            self.__is_check_down = False
 439            self.image = self.up_image
 440
 441            if self.command is not None:
 442                self.command(*self.args)
 443        elif self.is_hover():
 444            self.image = self.over_image
 445        else:
 446            self.image = self.up_image
 447
 448    def draw(self):
 449        """Draw the Button"""
 450        if self.hidden:
 451            return
 452        msg_color = self.text_color[0] if not self.lock else self.text_color[1]
 453        msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, msg_color)
 454        msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
 455        msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
 456
 457        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)
 458        self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
 459
 460
 461class TextButton:
 462    """A text button created from text"""
 463
 464    BUTTON_UP = 0
 465    BUTTON_DOWN = 1
 466    BUTTON_OVER = 2
 467    BUTTON_LOCK = 3
 468
 469    def __init__(self, tbc: TextButtonConfig):
 470        self.screen = tbc.screen
 471        self.width, self.height = tbc.width, tbc.height
 472        self.rect = pygame.Rect(250, 200, self.width, self.height)
 473        self.sounds_on_chick = tbc.sounds_on_chick
 474        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(tbc.font, tbc.text_size)
 475        self.command = tbc.command
 476        self.args = tbc.args
 477        self.text = tbc.text
 478        self.hidden = False
 479        self.color = [tbc.button_color[0]]
 480        try:
 481            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[1])
 482        except IndexError:
 483            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[0])
 484        try:
 485            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[2])
 486        except IndexError:
 487            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[0])
 488        try:
 489            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[3])
 490        except IndexError:
 491            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[0])
 492        self.text_color = [tbc.text_color[0]]
 493        try:
 494            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[1])
 495        except IndexError:
 496            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[0])
 497        try:
 498            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[2])
 499        except IndexError:
 500            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[0])
 501        try:
 502            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[3])
 503        except IndexError:
 504            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[0])
 505
 506        self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_UP
 507        self.lock = False
 508
 509    def is_chick_down(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 510        """
 511        Check if the mouse is pressed within the text button
 512
 513        Args:
 514            event: Events passed in the event loop
 515
 516        Returns:
 517            bool: whether it was clicked
 518        """
 519        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN and self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 520            return True
 521        return False
 522
 523    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 524        """
 525        Update the Button
 526
 527        Args:
 528            event: Events passed in the event loop
 529
 530        Returns:
 531            bool: Whether to click the button
 532        """
 533        if self.hidden:
 534            return False
 535        if self.lock:
 536            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_LOCK
 537            return False
 538        if self.is_chick_down(event):
 539            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_DOWN
 540            if self.sounds_on_chick is not None:
 541                pygame.mixer.Sound(self.sounds_on_chick).play()
 542        elif self.button_is_chick(event):
 543            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_UP
 544            if self.command is not None:
 545                self.command(*self.args)
 546            return True
 547        elif self.button_is_hover(event):
 548            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_OVER
 549        else:
 550            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_UP
 551        return False
 552
 553    def button_is_chick(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 554        """
 555        Return Whether to chick
 556
 557        Args:
 558            event: Events passed in the event loop
 559
 560        Returns:
 561            bool: Whether to click
 562        """
 563        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
 564            return False
 565        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 566            return True
 567        return False
 568
 569    def button_is_hover(self, event):
 570        """
 571        Return Whether to hover
 572
 573        Args:
 574            event: Events passed in the event loop
 575
 576        Returns:
 577            bool: Whether to hover
 578        """
 579        if event.type in (pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN, pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP):
 580            return False
 581        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 582            return True
 583        return False
 584
 585    def draw(self) -> None:
 586        """Draw Button"""
 587        if self.hidden:
 588            return
 589        if self.mode == TextButton.BUTTON_UP:
 590            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[0], self.rect, width=0)
 591            pygame.draw.line(
 592                self.screen,
 593                (169, 169, 169),
 594                self.rect.bottomleft,
 595                self.rect.bottomright,
 596                width=4,
 597            )
 598            pygame.draw.line(
 599                self.screen,
 600                (169, 169, 169),
 601                self.rect.bottomright,
 602                self.rect.topright,
 603                width=4,
 604            )
 605            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[0])
 606            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
 607            msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
 608            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
 609        elif self.mode == TextButton.BUTTON_DOWN:
 610            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[1], self.rect, width=0)
 611            pygame.draw.line(
 612                self.screen,
 613                (169, 169, 169),
 614                self.rect.topleft,
 615                self.rect.topright,
 616                width=4,
 617            )
 618            pygame.draw.line(
 619                self.screen,
 620                (169, 169, 169),
 621                self.rect.bottomleft,
 622                self.rect.topleft,
 623                width=4,
 624            )
 625            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[2])
 626            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
 627            msg_rect.centery = self.rect.centery + 3
 628            msg_rect.centerx = self.rect.centerx + 3
 629            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
 630        elif self.mode == TextButton.BUTTON_OVER:
 631            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[2], self.rect, width=0)
 632            pygame.draw.line(
 633                self.screen,
 634                (169, 169, 169),
 635                self.rect.bottomleft,
 636                self.rect.bottomright,
 637                width=4,
 638            )
 639            pygame.draw.line(
 640                self.screen,
 641                (169, 169, 169),
 642                self.rect.bottomright,
 643                self.rect.topright,
 644                width=4,
 645            )
 646            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[3])
 647            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
 648            msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
 649            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
 650        else:
 651            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[3], self.rect, width=0)
 652            pygame.draw.line(
 653                self.screen,
 654                (169, 169, 169),
 655                self.rect.bottomleft,
 656                self.rect.bottomright,
 657                width=4,
 658            )
 659            pygame.draw.line(
 660                self.screen,
 661                (169, 169, 169),
 662                self.rect.bottomright,
 663                self.rect.topright,
 664                width=4,
 665            )
 666            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[1])
 667            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
 668            msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
 669            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
 670

 672class DisplayText:
 673    """
 674    Display Text on the scene
 675
 676    Args:
 677        screen(Screen): The surface of the scene to be drawn
 678        font(str): Draws a string representation of the font default: None
 679        size(int): The font size
 680        text(str): The text
 681        new_color(tuple): The text new_color
 682    """
 683
 684    def __init__(
 685        self,
 686        screen: Screen,
 687        *,
 688        font=None,
 689        size=20,
 690        text="",
 691        color=(255, 255, 255),
 692    ):
 693        pygame.font.init()
 694        self.screen = screen
 695        self.font: pygame.font.FontType = pygame.font.SysFont(font, size)
 696        self.text = ""
 697        self.color = color
 698        self.image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.color)
 699        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 700        self.set_value(text, color)
 701
 702    def set_value(self, new_text: str | None = None, new_color: Color | None = None):
 703        """
 704        Reset the text content and color
 705
 706        Args:
 707            new_text: new text, default: The original text
 708            new_color: new Color, default: The original color
 709        """
 710        if new_text is not None:
 711            self.text = new_text
 712        if new_color is not None:
 713            self.color = new_color
 714        self.image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.color)
 715        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 716
 717    def draw(self):
 718        """Draw the Text"""
 719        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)
 720
 721
 722class CheckBox:
 723    """A checkbox created based on an image"""
 724
 725    def __init__(self, cc: CheckBoxConfig) -> None:
 726        self.screen = cc.screen
 727        self.text = cc.text
 728        if cc.image_paths[0] == "CheckBox":
 729            self.on_up_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOnUp.png")
 730            self.off_up_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOffUp.png")
 731            self.on_down_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOnDown.png")
 732            self.off_down_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOffDown.png")
 733            self.on_up_image = pygame.image.load(self.on_up_image)
 734            self.on_down_image = pygame.image.load(self.on_down_image)
 735            self.off_up_image = pygame.image.load(self.off_up_image)
 736            self.off_down_image = pygame.image.load(self.off_down_image)
 737
 738        else:
 739            self.on_up_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[0])
 740            self.on_down_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[1])
 741            self.off_up_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[2])
 742            self.off_down_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[3])
 743
 744        self.lock = False
 745        self.is_check = False
 746        self.image_rect = self.on_up_image.get_rect()
 747        font = pygame.font.SysFont(cc.font, self.image_rect.height - 1)
 748        self.msg_image = font.render(cc.text, True, cc.text_color)
 749        self.msg_rect = self.msg_image.get_rect()
 750        self.msg_rect.left = self.image_rect.right + 5
 751        self.msg_rect.centery = self.image_rect.centery
 752        self.rect = pygame.Rect(
 753            self.image_rect.left,
 754            self.image_rect.top,
 755            self.msg_rect.right,
 756            self.image_rect.bottom,
 757        )
 758        self.image = self.on_up_image
 759
 760    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 761        """
 762        Update the CheckBox
 763
 764        Args:
 765            event: Events passed in the event loop
 766
 767        Returns:
 768            bool: Whether it is in a click status
 769        """
 770        if self.lock and self.is_check:
 771            self.image = self.off_down_image
 772        elif self.lock and not self.is_check:
 773            self.image = self.off_up_image
 774        elif not self.lock and self.is_check:
 775            self.image = self.on_down_image
 776        elif not self.lock and not self.is_check:
 777            self.image = self.on_up_image
 778        self.image_rect.topleft = self.rect.topleft
 779        self.msg_rect.left = self.image_rect.right + 3
 780        self.msg_rect.centery = self.image_rect.centery
 781
 782        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
 783            if self.rect.collidepoint(event.pos) and not self.lock:
 784                self.is_check = not self.is_check
 785                return True
 786        return False
 787
 788    def draw(self) -> None:
 789        """Draw the CheckBox"""
 790        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.image_rect)
 791        self.screen.blit(self.msg_image, self.msg_rect)
 792
 793
 794class Dragger:
 795    """
 796    A draggable image component
 797
 798    Args:
 799        screen (Screen): The surface of the scene to be drawn
 800        images (tuple): A set of image paths or Surface objects representing the states of the component,
 801        where the element images are in order: normal state, pressed state, suspended state, locked state
 802    """
 803
 804    def __init__(self, screen: Screen, images: tuple[pygame.Surface]):
 805        self.screen = screen
 806        self.up_image = images[0]
 807        try:
 808            self.down_image = images[1]
 809        except IndexError:
 810            self.down_image = images[0]
 811        try:
 812            self.over_image = images[2]
 813        except IndexError:
 814            self.over_image = images[0]
 815        try:
 816            self.lock_image = images[3]
 817        except IndexError:
 818            self.lock_image = images[0]
 819        if not isinstance(self.up_image, pygame.Surface):
 820            self.up_image = pygame.image.load(self.up_image)
 821            self.down_image = pygame.image.load(self.down_image)
 822            self.lock_image = pygame.image.load(self.lock_image)
 823            self.over_image = pygame.image.load(self.over_image)
 824        self.image = self.up_image
 825        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 826        self.__loop = 0
 827        self.__diffx = 0
 828        self.__diffy = 0
 829        self.__is_drag = False
 830        self.hidden = False
 831        self.lock = False
 832
 833    def is_drag(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 834        """
 835        Return Whether to drag
 836
 837        Args:
 838            event: Events passed in the event loop
 839
 840        Returns:
 841            bool: Whether to drag
 842        """
 843        if self.hidden or self.lock:
 844            return False
 845        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
 846            return False
 847        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 848            return True
 849        return False
 850
 851    def is_hover(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
 852        """
 853        Return Whether to hover
 854
 855        Args:
 856            event: Events passed in the event loop
 857
 858        Returns:
 859            bool: Whether to hover
 860        """
 861        if self.hidden or self.lock:
 862            return False
 863        if event == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
 864            return False
 865        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
 866            return True
 867        return False
 868
 869    def update(self, event) -> None:
 870        """
 871        Update Component
 872
 873        Args:
 874            event: Events passed in the event loop
 875        """
 876        if self.hidden:
 877            return
 878        if self.is_drag(event) or self.__is_drag:
 879            mousex, mousey = pygame.mouse.get_pos()
 880            if self.__loop == 0:
 881                self.__diffx = mousex - self.rect.left
 882                self.__diffy = mousey - self.rect.top
 883            self.image = self.down_image
 884            self.__is_drag = True
 885            self.rect.topleft = (mousex - self.__diffx, mousey - self.__diffy)
 886            self.__loop += 1
 887        elif self.is_hover(event):
 888            self.image = self.over_image
 889        elif self.lock:
 890            self.image = self.lock_image
 891        else:
 892            self.image = self.up_image
 893        if not pygame.mouse.get_pressed()[0]:
 894            self.__is_drag = False
 895            self.__loop = 0
 896
 897    def draw(self):
 898        """Draw Component"""
 899        if self.hidden:
 900            return
 901        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)
 902
 903
 904class Image:
 905    """
 906    An image that can be modified
 907
 908    Args:
 909        screen: pygame.Surface object for home screen
 910        loc: Screen coordinates for image placement
 911        image_path: The Path of image
 912        rect: The rect of image
 913
 914    Raises:
 915        ValueError: If neither loc nor rect is passed in
 916    """
 917
 918    def __init__(self, screen: Screen, image_path: Path, rect: pygame.Rect | None = None, loc: Position | None = None):
 919        if loc is None and rect is None:
 920            raise ValueError("loc or rect must be specified")
 921        self.screen = screen
 922        self.image = pygame.image.load(image_path)
 923        if rect is not None:
 924            self.rect = rect
 925        else:
 926            self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 927            self.rect.topleft = loc
 928        self.hidden = False
 929
 930    def flip(self, flip_horizontal: bool = False, flip_vertical: bool = False) -> None:
 931        """
 932        Flipping images
 933
 934        Args:
 935            flip_horizontal: Whether to flip horizontally, Default False
 936            flip_vertical: Whether to flip vertical, Default False
 937        """
 938        self.image = pygame.transform.flip(self.image, flip_horizontal, flip_vertical)
 939
 940    def set_move(self, x: int = 0, y: int = 0) -> None:
 941        """
 942        Overlay position
 943
 944        Args:
 945            x: The width-coordinate you want to add, Default 0
 946            y: The height-coordinate you want to add, Default 0
 947        """
 948        self.rect.centery += y
 949        self.rect.centerx += x
 950
 951    def rot_center(self, angle: Degree):
 952        """
 953        rotate an image while keeping its center and size
 954
 955        Args:
 956            angle: The angle you want to rotate
 957        """
 958        self.image = pygame.transform.rotate(self.image, angle)
 959        loc = self.rect.topleft
 960        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 961        self.rect = loc
 962
 963    def set_position(self, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
 964        """
 965        move in position
 966
 967        Args:
 968            x: width-coordinate
 969            y: height-coordinate
 970        """
 971        self.rect.center = (x, y)
 972
 973    def scale(self, width: px, height: px):
 974        """
 975        Resizing images
 976        Args:
 977            width: Width after scaling is completed
 978            height: Height after scaling is completed
 979        """
 980        self.image = pygame.transform.scale(self.image, (width, height))
 981        loc = self.rect.topleft
 982        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
 983        self.rect.topleft = loc
 984
 985    def get_rect(self) -> pygame.Rect:
 986        """Get the rectangle of the image"""
 987        return self.rect
 988
 989    def draw(self):
 990        """Draw the image"""
 991        if self.hidden:
 992            return
 993        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)
 994
 995
 996class RadioButtons:
 997    """
 998    Set of radio boxes based on checkboxes
 999    Args:
1000        screen (pghelper.Surface): The surface of the scene to be drawn
1001        buttons (list[CheckBox]): A list of CheckBox instances
1002    """
1003
1004    def __init__(self, screen: pygame.Surface, buttons: list[CheckBox]):
1005        self.screen = screen
1006        self.buttons = buttons
1007        self._last_button = None
1008
1009    def update(self, event):
1010        """
1011        Update Radio boxes
1012
1013        Args:
1014            event: Events passed in the event loop
1015        """
1016        for button in self.buttons:
1017            _event = pygame.event.Event(pygame.KEYDOWN)
1018            button.update(_event)
1019        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
1020            for button in self.buttons:
1021                if button.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()) and not button.is_check:
1022                    button.is_check = True
1023                    button.image = button.on_down_image
1024                    if self._last_button is not None:
1025                        self._last_button.is_check = False
1026                    self._last_button = button
1027                    break
1028
1029    def get_focus(self) -> int | None:
1030        """Returns which radio box is selected"""
1031        for i in range(len(self.buttons)):
1032            if self.buttons[i].image == self.buttons[i].on_down_image:
1033                return i
1034            if self.buttons[i].image == self.buttons[i].off_down_image:
1035                return i
1036        return None
1037
1038    def draw(self):
1039        """Draw Radio boxes"""
1040        for button in self.buttons:
1041            button.draw()
1042
1043
1044class InputText:
1045    """An input box for the user to enter"""
1046
1047    CANCELLED_TAB = -1
1048    KEY_REPEAT_DELAY = 500  # ms before starting to repeat
1049    KEY_REPEAT_RATE = 50  # ms between repeating keys
1050
1051    def __init__(self, itc: InputTextConfig):
1052        self.__cursor_loc = None
1053        self.__focused_image_rect = None
1054        self.rect = None
1055        self.image_rect = None
1056        self.loc = None
1057        self.__next_field_on_tab = None
1058        self.__cursor_ms_counter = None
1059        self.cursor_position = None
1060        self.__text = None
1061        self.__focus = None
1062        self.__cursor_visible = None
1063        self._init(
1064            itc.screen,
1065            itc.loc,
1066            itc.value,
1067            itc.font,
1068            itc.font_size,
1069            itc.width,
1070            itc.text_color,
1071            itc.color,
1072            itc.focus_color,
1073            itc.init_focus,
1074            itc.mask,
1075            itc.keep_focus_on_submit,
1076            itc,
1077        )
1078
1079    def _init(
1080        self,
1081        window: Screen,
1082        loc: Position,
1083        value,
1084        font_name,
1085        font_size,
1086        width,
1087        text_color,
1088        background_color,
1089        focus_color,
1090        initial_focus,
1091        mask,
1092        keep_focus_on_submit,
1093        itc,
1094    ):
1095        """
1096        initialization
1097        This method shouldn't be accessed, it's not an interface, it's an implementation.
1098        """
1099
1100        self.is_enabled = True
1101        self.hidden = False
1102
1103        self.screen = window
1104        self.loc = loc
1105        self.__text = value
1106        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(font_name, font_size)
1107
1108        self.command = itc.command
1109        self.args = itc.args
1110
1111        self.width = width
1112        self.__focus = initial_focus
1113        self.__text_color = text_color
1114        self.__background_color = background_color
1115        self.__focus_color = focus_color  # new_color of __focus rectangle around __text
1116        self.mask = mask
1117        self.__keep_focus_on_submit = keep_focus_on_submit
1118        self.__next_field_on_tab = None
1119        self.key_is_repeating = False
1120        self.repeating_key = None
1121
1122        # Get the height of the field by getting the size of the font
1123        self.height = self.font.get_height()
1124        # Set the rect of the __text image
1125        self.image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1126        self.rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1127        # Set the rect of the __focus highlight rectangle (when the __text has been clicked on and has __focus)
1128        self.__focused_image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0] - 3, self.loc[1] - 3, self.width + 6, self.height + 6)
1129
1130        # Cursor related things:
1131        self.cursor_surface = pygame.Surface((1, self.height))
1132        self.cursor_surface.fill(self.__text_color)
1133        self.cursor_position = len(self.__text)  # put the cursor at the end of the initial __text
1134        self.__cursor_visible = False
1135        self.__cursor_switch_ms = 500  # Blink every half-second
1136        self.__cursor_ms_counter = 0
1137        # this is a list because element 0 will change as the user edits
1138        self.__cursor_loc = [self.loc[0], self.loc[1]]
1139        self.clock = pygame.time.Clock()
1140
1141        # Create one surface, blit the __text into it during _update_image
1142        # Special flags are needed to set the background alpha as transparent
1143        self.__text_image = pygame.Surface((self.width, self.height), flags=pygame.SRCALPHA)
1144
1145        self._update_image()  # create the image of the starting __text
1146
1147    def _update_image(self):
1148        """
1149        Internal method to render __text as an image.
1150        This method shouldn't be accessed, it's not an interface, it's an implementation.
1151        """
1152        if self.__background_color is not None:
1153            self.__text_image.fill(self.__background_color)
1154
1155        # Render the __text as a single line, and blit it onto the __text_image surface
1156        if self.mask is None:
1157            line_surface = self.font.render(self.__text, True, self.__text_color)
1158        else:
1159            n_chars = len(self.__text)
1160            masked_text = self.mask * n_chars
1161            line_surface = self.font.render(masked_text, True, self.__text_color)
1162        self.__text_image.blit(line_surface, (0, 0))
1163
1164    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
1165        """
1166        Update the InputBox
1167
1168        Args:
1169            event: Events passed in the event loop
1170
1171        Returns:
1172            bool: Whether it is in a click status
1173        """
1174        if not self.is_enabled:
1175            return False
1176        if self.hidden:
1177            return False
1178
1179        if (event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN) and (event.button == 1):  # user clicked
1180            the_x, the_y = event.pos
1181
1182            if self.image_rect.collidepoint(the_x, the_y):
1183                if not self.__focus:
1184                    self.__focus = True  # give this field __focus
1185                    pygame.key.set_repeat(InputText.KEY_REPEAT_DELAY, InputText.KEY_REPEAT_RATE)
1186                else:
1187                    # Field already has __focus, must position the cursor where the user clicked
1188                    n_pixels_from_left = the_x - self.loc[0]
1189                    n_chars = len(self.__text)
1190
1191                    last_char_offset = self.font.size(self.__text)[0]
1192                    if n_pixels_from_left >= last_char_offset:
1193                        self.cursor_position = n_chars
1194                    else:
1195                        for this_char_num in range(0, n_chars):
1196                            this_char_offset = self.font.size(self.__text[:this_char_num])[0]
1197                            if this_char_offset >= n_pixels_from_left:
1198                                self.cursor_position = this_char_num  # Found the proper position for the cursor
1199                                break
1200                    self.__cursor_visible = True  # Show the cursor at the click point
1201
1202            else:
1203                self.__focus = False
1204            return False  # means:  handled click, nothing for client to do
1205
1206        if not self.__focus:  # if this field does not have __focus, don't do anything
1207            return False
1208
1209        if event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
1210            current_key = event.key
1211
1212            if current_key in (pygame.K_RETURN, pygame.K_KP_ENTER):
1213                self.__focus = self.__keep_focus_on_submit  # defaults to False - lose __focus with Enter/Return
1214                if not self.__focus:
1215                    pygame.key.set_repeat(0)  # turn off repeating characters
1216                self._update_image()
1217
1218                if self.command is not None:
1219                    self.command(*self.args)
1220
1221                # User is done typing, return True to signal that __text is available (via a call to get_value)
1222                return True
1223
1224            elif current_key == InputText.CANCELLED_TAB:
1225                # See code below setting up CANCELLED_TAB
1226                # If we get a CANCELLED_TAB as the current key, ignore it, already shifted __focus
1227                pass
1228
1229            elif current_key == pygame.K_BACKSPACE:
1230                self.__text = self.__text[: max(self.cursor_position - 1, 0)] + self.__text[self.cursor_position :]
1231
1232                # Subtract one from cursor_pos, but do not go below zero:
1233                self.cursor_position = max(self.cursor_position - 1, 0)
1234                self._update_image()
1235
1236            elif current_key == pygame.K_DELETE:  # forward delete key
1237                self.__text = self.__text[: self.cursor_position] + self.__text[self.cursor_position + 1 :]
1238                self._update_image()
1239
1240            elif current_key == pygame.K_RIGHT:
1241                if self.cursor_position < len(self.__text):
1242                    self.cursor_position += 1
1243
1244            elif current_key == pygame.K_LEFT:
1245                if self.cursor_position > 0:
1246                    self.cursor_position -= 1
1247
1248            elif current_key == pygame.K_END:
1249                self.cursor_position = len(self.__text)
1250
1251            elif current_key == pygame.K_HOME:
1252                self.cursor_position = 0
1253
1254            elif current_key in (pygame.K_UP, pygame.K_DOWN):
1255                pass
1256
1257            elif current_key == pygame.K_TAB:
1258                if self.__next_field_on_tab is not None:  # Move __focus to a different field
1259                    self.remove_focus()
1260                    self.__next_field_on_tab.give_focus()
1261
1262                    # The TAB key is sent to all fields.  If this field is *before* the field
1263                    # gaining __focus, we cannot send the TAB to that field
1264                    # So, we change the key to something that will be ignored when it is
1265                    # received in the target field
1266                    event.key = InputText.CANCELLED_TAB
1267
1268            else:  # standard key
1269                # If no special key is pressed, add unicode of key to input_string
1270                unicode_of_key = event.unicode  # remember for potential repeating key
1271                self.__text = self.__text[: self.cursor_position] + unicode_of_key + self.__text[self.cursor_position :]
1272                self.cursor_position += len(unicode_of_key)
1273                self._update_image()
1274
1275        return False  # means: handled key, nothing for client code to do
1276
1277    def draw(self):
1278        """Draws the Text in the screen."""
1279        if self.hidden:
1280            return
1281
1282        # If this input __text has __focus, draw an outline around the __text image
1283        if self.__focus:
1284            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.__focus_color, self.__focused_image_rect, 1)
1285
1286        # Blit in the image of __text (set earlier in _update_image)
1287        self.screen.blit(self.__text_image, self.loc)
1288
1289        # If this field has __focus, see if it is time to blink the cursor
1290        if self.__focus:
1291            self.__cursor_ms_counter += self.clock.get_time()
1292            if self.__cursor_ms_counter >= self.__cursor_switch_ms:
1293                self.__cursor_ms_counter %= self.__cursor_switch_ms
1294                self.__cursor_visible = not self.__cursor_visible
1295
1296            if self.__cursor_visible:
1297                cursor_offset = self.font.size(self.__text[: self.cursor_position])[0]
1298                if self.cursor_position > 0:  # Try to get between characters
1299                    cursor_offset -= 1
1300                if cursor_offset < self.width:  # if the loc is within the __text area, draw it
1301                    self.__cursor_loc[0] = self.loc[0] + cursor_offset
1302                    self.screen.blit(self.cursor_surface, self.__cursor_loc)
1303
1304            self.clock.tick()
1305
1306    # Helper methods
1307    def get_value(self) -> str:
1308        """Returns the text entered by the user"""
1309        return self.__text
1310
1311    def set_value(self, new_text: str):
1312        """
1313        Sets new text into the field
1314
1315        Args:
1316            new_text: The text you want to use
1317        """
1318        self.__text = new_text
1319        self.cursor_position = len(self.__text)
1320        self._update_image()
1321
1322    def is_focus(self) -> bool:
1323        """
1324        Returns:
1325            bool: Does InputText have a focus
1326        """
1327        return self.__focus
1328
1329    def clear(self, keep_focus: bool = False):
1330        """
1331        Clear the text in the field
1332
1333        Args:
1334            keep_focus: Do you want to keep the focus
1335        """
1336        self.__text = ""
1337        self.__focus = keep_focus
1338        self._update_image()
1339
1340    def remove_focus(self):
1341        self.__focus = False
1342
1343    def give_focus(self):
1344        """
1345        Give focus to this field
1346        Make sure focus is removed from any previous field before calling this
1347        """
1348        self.__focus = True
1349
1350    def set_next_field_on_tab(self, next_field_on_tab: str):
1351        """
1352        Args:
1353            next_field_on_tab: The next field you want to set
1354
1355        """
1356        self.__next_field_on_tab = next_field_on_tab
1357
1358    def set_loc(self, loc: Position):
1359        """
1360        set position
1361
1362        Args
1363            loc: Coordinates on the screen coordinate system
1364        """
1365        self.loc = loc
1366        self.rect[0] = self.loc[0]
1367        self.rect[1] = self.loc[1]
1368
1369        self.image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1370        self.rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1371        # Set the rect of the __focus highlight rectangle (when the __text has been clicked on and has __focus)
1372        self.__focused_image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0] - 3, self.loc[1] - 3, self.width + 6, self.height + 6)
1373        # this is a list because element 0 will change as the user edits
1374        self.__cursor_loc = [self.loc[0], self.loc[1]]
class Animate: 
280class Animate:
281    """An animation class based on a series of loaded images"""
282
283    def __init__(self, ac: AnimateConfig):
284        self.screen = ac.screen
285        self.images = []
286        self.duration = ac.duration
287        self.rect = []
288        self._pause = False
289        self.nimage = 0
290        self.xloop = False
291        self.elapsed = 0
292        for image in ac.images:
293            this_image = image
294            this_rect = this_image.get_rect()
295            self.rect.append(this_rect)
296            self.images.append(this_image)
297            self.nimage += 1
298        self.loop = ac.loop
299        self.nloop = ac.nloop
300        self.start_time = 0
301        self.show_first_image_at_end = ac.show_first_image_at_end
302        self.playing = False
303        self.index = 0
304        if ac.autostart:
305            self.play()
306            self.update()
307            self.draw()
308
309    def play(self):
310        """Playing the animate"""
311        self.playing = True
312        if self._pause:
313            self._pause = False
314            return
315        self.start_time = time.time()
316        self.index = 0
317
318    def pause(self):
319        """Pause the animate"""
320        self._pause = True
321
322    def update(self):
323        """Update the animate, Should be called from the main game loop"""
324        if not self.playing or self._pause:
325            return
326
327        self.elapsed = time.time() - self.start_time
328        if self.elapsed > self.duration:
329            self.index += 1
330            if self.index >= self.nimage:
331                self.nloop -= 1
332                self.index = 1
333                if self.nloop <= 0 and not self.loop:
334                    self.playing = False
335                    if self.show_first_image_at_end:
336                        self.index = 0
337                        self.draw()
338            else:
339                self.start_time = time.time()
340
341    def draw(self):
342        """Draw the animate"""
343        self.screen.blit(self.images[self.index], self.rect[self.index])

class AnimateConfig(BaseConfig): 
116class AnimateConfig(BaseConfig):
117    """
118    This is the configuration class for the Animate class.
119    This class requires a set of images in addition to the basic screen parameter, as described in the images property
120    It includes the following configuration options
121
122    Attributes:
123        - images (tuple): This property can be a set of image paths to animate or a set of loaded image objects. If you
124         need to animate as a Sprite, use the pghelper.disassemble_sprite_sheet() function
125        - autostart (bool): This property indicates if the animation will start automatically and defaults to False
126        - show_first_image_at_end(bool): This property is a Boolean indicating whether to show the first image after the
127         animation is playing.It defaults to True
128        - loop (bool): This property is a Boolean indicating whether the animation should loop indefinitely and defaults to
129         False
130        - nloop (int): This property specifies how many times the animation should loop and defaults to 1
131        - duration(int): This property specifies that the image is switched every few Seconds
132    """
133
134    def __init__(self, screen, images):
135        super().__init__(screen)
136        if isinstance(images[0], str):
137            self.images = load_images(images)
138        else:
139            self.images = images
140        self.autostart = False
141        self.show_first_image_at_end = True
142        self.loop = False
143        self.nloop = 1
144        self.duration = 0.1

class CustomButton: 
346class CustomButton:
347    """An image-based custom _button class"""
348
349    def __init__(self, bc: CustomButtonConfig):
350        self.screen = bc.screen
351        self.screen_rect = bc.screen.get_rect()
352        self.__is_check_down = False
353        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(bc.font, bc.font_size)
354        self.text = bc.text
355        self.command = bc.command
356        self.args = bc.args
357        self.text_color = bc.text_color
358        self.sounds_on_chick = bc.sounds_on_chick
359        self.up_image = bc.images[0]
360        try:
361            self.down_image = bc.images[1]
362        except IndexError:
363            self.down_image = bc.images[0]
364        try:
365            self.over_image = bc.images[2]
366        except IndexError:
367            self.over_image = bc.images[0]
368        try:
369            self.lock_image = bc.images[3]
370        except IndexError:
371            self.lock_image = bc.images[0]
372        if isinstance(self.up_image, str):
373            self.up_image = pygame.image.load(self.up_image).convert().convert_alpha()
374        if isinstance(self.down_image, str):
375            self.down_image = pygame.image.load(self.down_image).convert().convert_alpha()
376        if isinstance(self.over_image, str):
377            self.over_image = pygame.image.load(self.over_image).convert().convert_alpha()
378        if isinstance(self.lock_image, str):
379            self.lock_image = pygame.image.load(self.lock_image).convert().convert_alpha()
380        self.image = self.up_image
381        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
382        self.hidden = False
383        self.lock = False
384
385    def is_chick(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
386        """
387        Return Whether to click
388
389        Args:
390            event: Events passed in the event loop
391        """
392        if self.hidden or self.lock:
393            return False
394        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
395            return False
396        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
397            return True
398        return False
399
400    def _is_check_down(self, event):
401        if not self.__is_check_down:
402            return False
403        if self.hidden or self.lock:
404            return False
405        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
406            return False
407        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
408            return True
409        return False
410
411    def is_hover(self) -> bool:
412        """Return Whether to hover"""
413        if self.hidden or self.lock:
414            return False
415        if pygame.mouse.get_pressed()[0]:
416            return False
417        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
418            return True
419        return False
420
421    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType):
422        """
423        Update the Button
424
425        Args:
426            event: Events passed in the event loop
427        """
428        if self.hidden:
429            return
430        if self.lock:
431            self.image = self.lock_image
432        elif self._is_check_down(event):
433            self.__is_check_down = True
434            self.image = self.down_image
435            if self.sounds_on_chick is not None:
436                sound = pygame.mixer.Sound(self.sounds_on_chick)
437                sound.play()
438        elif self.is_chick(event):
439            self.__is_check_down = False
440            self.image = self.up_image
441
442            if self.command is not None:
443                self.command(*self.args)
444        elif self.is_hover():
445            self.image = self.over_image
446        else:
447            self.image = self.up_image
448
449    def draw(self):
450        """Draw the Button"""
451        if self.hidden:
452            return
453        msg_color = self.text_color[0] if not self.lock else self.text_color[1]
454        msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, msg_color)
455        msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
456        msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
457
458        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)
459        self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)

class CustomButtonConfig(BaseConfig): 
147class CustomButtonConfig(BaseConfig):
148    """
149    This is the configuration class for the CustomButton class. It includes the following configuration options
150    In addition to the basic screen parameter, this class also requires the image_paths parameter, as described in
151    the description of the image_paths property
152    Attributes:
153        - image_paths: This is a tuple of paths for all images, which should be passed in "release state, hold state, hover
154         state, lock state". If any of the last three are specified, it is automatically set to the first
155        - sounds_on_chick: This is the sound effect that was played when the _button was clicked and is a string pointing to
156         the sound effect location. The default is None, which means no sound effect will be played.
157        - command: is what needs to be done when the _button is pressed, is of type Function, defaults to None, i.e.,
158         does nothing.
159        - args: This is a tuple containing all the arguments of the command function
160    """
161
162    def __init__(self, screen: pygame.SurfaceType, images: Union[list, tuple]):
163        super().__init__(screen)
164        if not isinstance(images, list):
165            images = list(images)
166        self.text_color: Union[list, tuple] = [(255, 255, 255), (190, 190, 190)]
167        self.text: str = ""
168        self.font: Optional[pygame.font.FontType] = None
169        self.font_size: int = 20
170        self.images: list = images
171        self.sounds_on_chick: Optional[pygame.mixer.SoundType] = None
172        self.command: Optional[Callable] = None
173        self.args: tuple = tuple()

This is the configuration class for the CustomButton class. It includes the following configuration options In addition to the basic screen parameter, this class also requires the image_paths parameter, as described in the description of the image_paths property Attributes: - image_paths: This is a tuple of paths for all images, which should be passed in "release state, hold state, hover state, lock state". If any of the last three are specified, it is automatically set to the first - sounds_on_chick: This is the sound effect that was played when the _button was clicked and is a string pointing to the sound effect location. The default is None, which means no sound effect will be played. - command: is what needs to be done when the _button is pressed, is of type Function, defaults to None, i.e., does nothing. - args: This is a tuple containing all the arguments of the command function

class TextButton: 
462class TextButton:
463    """A text button created from text"""
464
465    BUTTON_UP = 0
466    BUTTON_DOWN = 1
467    BUTTON_OVER = 2
468    BUTTON_LOCK = 3
469
470    def __init__(self, tbc: TextButtonConfig):
471        self.screen = tbc.screen
472        self.width, self.height = tbc.width, tbc.height
473        self.rect = pygame.Rect(250, 200, self.width, self.height)
474        self.sounds_on_chick = tbc.sounds_on_chick
475        self.font = pygame.font.SysFont(tbc.font, tbc.text_size)
476        self.command = tbc.command
477        self.args = tbc.args
478        self.text = tbc.text
479        self.hidden = False
480        self.color = [tbc.button_color[0]]
481        try:
482            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[1])
483        except IndexError:
484            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[0])
485        try:
486            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[2])
487        except IndexError:
488            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[0])
489        try:
490            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[3])
491        except IndexError:
492            self.color.append(tbc.button_color[0])
493        self.text_color = [tbc.text_color[0]]
494        try:
495            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[1])
496        except IndexError:
497            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[0])
498        try:
499            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[2])
500        except IndexError:
501            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[0])
502        try:
503            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[3])
504        except IndexError:
505            self.text_color.append(tbc.text_color[0])
506
507        self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_UP
508        self.lock = False
509
510    def is_chick_down(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
511        """
512        Check if the mouse is pressed within the text button
513
514        Args:
515            event: Events passed in the event loop
516
517        Returns:
518            bool: whether it was clicked
519        """
520        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN and self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
521            return True
522        return False
523
524    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
525        """
526        Update the Button
527
528        Args:
529            event: Events passed in the event loop
530
531        Returns:
532            bool: Whether to click the button
533        """
534        if self.hidden:
535            return False
536        if self.lock:
537            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_LOCK
538            return False
539        if self.is_chick_down(event):
540            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_DOWN
541            if self.sounds_on_chick is not None:
542                pygame.mixer.Sound(self.sounds_on_chick).play()
543        elif self.button_is_chick(event):
544            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_UP
545            if self.command is not None:
546                self.command(*self.args)
547            return True
548        elif self.button_is_hover(event):
549            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_OVER
550        else:
551            self.mode = TextButton.BUTTON_UP
552        return False
553
554    def button_is_chick(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
555        """
556        Return Whether to chick
557
558        Args:
559            event: Events passed in the event loop
560
561        Returns:
562            bool: Whether to click
563        """
564        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
565            return False
566        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
567            return True
568        return False
569
570    def button_is_hover(self, event):
571        """
572        Return Whether to hover
573
574        Args:
575            event: Events passed in the event loop
576
577        Returns:
578            bool: Whether to hover
579        """
580        if event.type in (pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN, pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP):
581            return False
582        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
583            return True
584        return False
585
586    def draw(self) -> None:
587        """Draw Button"""
588        if self.hidden:
589            return
590        if self.mode == TextButton.BUTTON_UP:
591            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[0], self.rect, width=0)
592            pygame.draw.line(
593                self.screen,
594                (169, 169, 169),
595                self.rect.bottomleft,
596                self.rect.bottomright,
597                width=4,
598            )
599            pygame.draw.line(
600                self.screen,
601                (169, 169, 169),
602                self.rect.bottomright,
603                self.rect.topright,
604                width=4,
605            )
606            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[0])
607            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
608            msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
609            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
610        elif self.mode == TextButton.BUTTON_DOWN:
611            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[1], self.rect, width=0)
612            pygame.draw.line(
613                self.screen,
614                (169, 169, 169),
615                self.rect.topleft,
616                self.rect.topright,
617                width=4,
618            )
619            pygame.draw.line(
620                self.screen,
621                (169, 169, 169),
622                self.rect.bottomleft,
623                self.rect.topleft,
624                width=4,
625            )
626            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[2])
627            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
628            msg_rect.centery = self.rect.centery + 3
629            msg_rect.centerx = self.rect.centerx + 3
630            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
631        elif self.mode == TextButton.BUTTON_OVER:
632            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[2], self.rect, width=0)
633            pygame.draw.line(
634                self.screen,
635                (169, 169, 169),
636                self.rect.bottomleft,
637                self.rect.bottomright,
638                width=4,
639            )
640            pygame.draw.line(
641                self.screen,
642                (169, 169, 169),
643                self.rect.bottomright,
644                self.rect.topright,
645                width=4,
646            )
647            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[3])
648            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
649            msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
650            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)
651        else:
652            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.color[3], self.rect, width=0)
653            pygame.draw.line(
654                self.screen,
655                (169, 169, 169),
656                self.rect.bottomleft,
657                self.rect.bottomright,
658                width=4,
659            )
660            pygame.draw.line(
661                self.screen,
662                (169, 169, 169),
663                self.rect.bottomright,
664                self.rect.topright,
665                width=4,
666            )
667            msg_image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color[1])
668            msg_rect = msg_image.get_rect()
669            msg_rect.center = self.rect.center
670            self.screen.blit(msg_image, msg_rect)

class CheckBox: 
723class CheckBox:
724    """A checkbox created based on an image"""
725
726    def __init__(self, cc: CheckBoxConfig) -> None:
727        self.screen = cc.screen
728        self.text = cc.text
729        if cc.image_paths[0] == "CheckBox":
730            self.on_up_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOnUp.png")
731            self.off_up_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOffUp.png")
732            self.on_down_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOnDown.png")
733            self.off_down_image = os.path.join(_PYTHON_PATH, "images", "CheckBoxOffDown.png")
734            self.on_up_image = pygame.image.load(self.on_up_image)
735            self.on_down_image = pygame.image.load(self.on_down_image)
736            self.off_up_image = pygame.image.load(self.off_up_image)
737            self.off_down_image = pygame.image.load(self.off_down_image)
738
739        else:
740            self.on_up_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[0])
741            self.on_down_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[1])
742            self.off_up_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[2])
743            self.off_down_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[3])
744
745        self.lock = False
746        self.is_check = False
747        self.image_rect = self.on_up_image.get_rect()
748        font = pygame.font.SysFont(cc.font, self.image_rect.height - 1)
749        self.msg_image = font.render(cc.text, True, cc.text_color)
750        self.msg_rect = self.msg_image.get_rect()
751        self.msg_rect.left = self.image_rect.right + 5
752        self.msg_rect.centery = self.image_rect.centery
753        self.rect = pygame.Rect(
754            self.image_rect.left,
755            self.image_rect.top,
756            self.msg_rect.right,
757            self.image_rect.bottom,
758        )
759        self.image = self.on_up_image
760
761    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
762        """
763        Update the CheckBox
764
765        Args:
766            event: Events passed in the event loop
767
768        Returns:
769            bool: Whether it is in a click status
770        """
771        if self.lock and self.is_check:
772            self.image = self.off_down_image
773        elif self.lock and not self.is_check:
774            self.image = self.off_up_image
775        elif not self.lock and self.is_check:
776            self.image = self.on_down_image
777        elif not self.lock and not self.is_check:
778            self.image = self.on_up_image
779        self.image_rect.topleft = self.rect.topleft
780        self.msg_rect.left = self.image_rect.right + 3
781        self.msg_rect.centery = self.image_rect.centery
782
783        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
784            if self.rect.collidepoint(event.pos) and not self.lock:
785                self.is_check = not self.is_check
786                return True
787        return False
788
789    def draw(self) -> None:
790        """Draw the CheckBox"""
791        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.image_rect)
792        self.screen.blit(self.msg_image, self.msg_rect)

734            self.on_up_image = pygame.image.load(self.on_up_image)

736            self.off_up_image = pygame.image.load(self.off_up_image)
737            self.off_down_image = pygame.image.load(self.off_down_image)
738
739        else:
740            self.on_up_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[0])
741            self.on_down_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[1])
742            self.off_up_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[2])
743            self.off_down_image = pygame.image.load(cc.image_paths[3])
744
745        self.lock = False
746        self.is_check = False
747        self.image_rect = self.on_up_image.get_rect()
748        font = pygame.font.SysFont(cc.font, self.image_rect.height - 1)
749        self.msg_image = font.render(cc.text, True, cc.text_color)
750        self.msg_rect = self.msg_image.get_rect()
751        self.msg_rect.left = self.image_rect.right + 5
752        self.msg_rect.centery = self.image_rect.centery
753        self.rect = pygame.Rect(
754            self.image_rect.left,
755            self.image_rect.top,
756            self.msg_rect.right,
757            self.image_rect.bottom,
758        )
759        self.image = self.on_up_image

def update(self, event: pygame.event.Event) -> bool: 
761    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
762        """
763        Update the CheckBox
764
765        Args:
766            event: Events passed in the event loop
767
768        Returns:
769            bool: Whether it is in a click status
770        """
771        if self.lock and self.is_check:
772            self.image = self.off_down_image
773        elif self.lock and not self.is_check:
774            self.image = self.off_up_image
775        elif not self.lock and self.is_check:
776            self.image = self.on_down_image
777        elif not self.lock and not self.is_check:
778            self.image = self.on_up_image
779        self.image_rect.topleft = self.rect.topleft
780        self.msg_rect.left = self.image_rect.right + 3
781        self.msg_rect.centery = self.image_rect.centery
782
783        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
784            if self.rect.collidepoint(event.pos) and not self.lock:
785                self.is_check = not self.is_check
786                return True
787        return False
