class Dragger: 
795class Dragger:
796    """
797    A draggable image component
798
799    Args:
800        screen (Screen): The surface of the scene to be drawn
801        images (tuple): A set of image paths or Surface objects representing the states of the component,
802        where the element images are in order: normal state, pressed state, suspended state, locked state
803    """
804
805    def __init__(self, screen: Screen, images: tuple[pygame.Surface]):
806        self.screen = screen
807        self.up_image = images[0]
808        try:
809            self.down_image = images[1]
810        except IndexError:
811            self.down_image = images[0]
812        try:
813            self.over_image = images[2]
814        except IndexError:
815            self.over_image = images[0]
816        try:
817            self.lock_image = images[3]
818        except IndexError:
819            self.lock_image = images[0]
820        if not isinstance(self.up_image, pygame.Surface):
821            self.up_image = pygame.image.load(self.up_image)
822            self.down_image = pygame.image.load(self.down_image)
823            self.lock_image = pygame.image.load(self.lock_image)
824            self.over_image = pygame.image.load(self.over_image)
825        self.image = self.up_image
826        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
827        self.__loop = 0
828        self.__diffx = 0
829        self.__diffy = 0
830        self.__is_drag = False
831        self.hidden = False
832        self.lock = False
833
834    def is_drag(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
835        """
836        Return Whether to drag
837
838        Args:
839            event: Events passed in the event loop
840
841        Returns:
842            bool: Whether to drag
843        """
844        if self.hidden or self.lock:
845            return False
846        if event.type != pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
847            return False
848        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
849            return True
850        return False
851
852    def is_hover(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
853        """
854        Return Whether to hover
855
856        Args:
857            event: Events passed in the event loop
858
859        Returns:
860            bool: Whether to hover
861        """
862        if self.hidden or self.lock:
863            return False
864        if event == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
865            return False
866        if self.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()):
867            return True
868        return False
869
870    def update(self, event) -> None:
871        """
872        Update Component
873
874        Args:
875            event: Events passed in the event loop
876        """
877        if self.hidden:
878            return
879        if self.is_drag(event) or self.__is_drag:
880            mousex, mousey = pygame.mouse.get_pos()
881            if self.__loop == 0:
882                self.__diffx = mousex - self.rect.left
883                self.__diffy = mousey - self.rect.top
884            self.image = self.down_image
885            self.__is_drag = True
886            self.rect.topleft = (mousex - self.__diffx, mousey - self.__diffy)
887            self.__loop += 1
888        elif self.is_hover(event):
889            self.image = self.over_image
890        elif self.lock:
891            self.image = self.lock_image
892        else:
893            self.image = self.up_image
894        if not pygame.mouse.get_pressed()[0]:
895            self.__is_drag = False
896            self.__loop = 0
897
898    def draw(self):
899        """Draw Component"""
900        if self.hidden:
901            return
902        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)

673class DisplayText:
674    """
675    Display Text on the scene
676
677    Args:
678        screen(Screen): The surface of the scene to be drawn
679        font(str): Draws a string representation of the font default: None
680        size(int): The font size
681        text(str): The text
682        new_color(tuple): The text new_color
683    """
684
685    def __init__(
686        self,
687        screen: Screen,
688        *,
689        font=None,
690        size=20,
691        text="",
692        color=(255, 255, 255),
693    ):
694        pygame.font.init()
695        self.screen = screen
696        self.font: pygame.font.FontType = pygame.font.SysFont(font, size)
697        self.text = ""
698        self.color = color
699        self.image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.color)
700        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
701        self.set_value(text, color)
702
703    def set_value(self, new_text: str | None = None, new_color: Color | None = None):
704        """
705        Reset the text content and color
706
707        Args:
708            new_text: new text, default: The original text
709            new_color: new Color, default: The original color
710        """
711        if new_text is not None:
712            self.text = new_text
713        if new_color is not None:
714            self.color = new_color
715        self.image = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.color)
716        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
717
718    def draw(self):
719        """Draw the Text"""
720        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)

class Image: 
905class Image:
906    """
907    An image that can be modified
908
909    Args:
910        screen: pygame.Surface object for home screen
911        loc: Screen coordinates for image placement
912        image_path: The Path of image
913        rect: The rect of image
914
915    Raises:
916        ValueError: If neither loc nor rect is passed in
917    """
918
919    def __init__(self, screen: Screen, image_path: Path, rect: pygame.Rect | None = None, loc: Position | None = None):
920        if loc is None and rect is None:
921            raise ValueError("loc or rect must be specified")
922        self.screen = screen
923        self.image = pygame.image.load(image_path)
924        if rect is not None:
925            self.rect = rect
926        else:
927            self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
928            self.rect.topleft = loc
929        self.hidden = False
930
931    def flip(self, flip_horizontal: bool = False, flip_vertical: bool = False) -> None:
932        """
933        Flipping images
934
935        Args:
936            flip_horizontal: Whether to flip horizontally, Default False
937            flip_vertical: Whether to flip vertical, Default False
938        """
939        self.image = pygame.transform.flip(self.image, flip_horizontal, flip_vertical)
940
941    def set_move(self, x: int = 0, y: int = 0) -> None:
942        """
943        Overlay position
944
945        Args:
946            x: The width-coordinate you want to add, Default 0
947            y: The height-coordinate you want to add, Default 0
948        """
949        self.rect.centery += y
950        self.rect.centerx += x
951
952    def rot_center(self, angle: Degree):
953        """
954        rotate an image while keeping its center and size
955
956        Args:
957            angle: The angle you want to rotate
958        """
959        self.image = pygame.transform.rotate(self.image, angle)
960        loc = self.rect.topleft
961        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
962        self.rect = loc
963
964    def set_position(self, x: int = 0, y: int = 0):
965        """
966        move in position
967
968        Args:
969            x: width-coordinate
970            y: height-coordinate
971        """
972        self.rect.center = (x, y)
973
974    def scale(self, width: px, height: px):
975        """
976        Resizing images
977        Args:
978            width: Width after scaling is completed
979            height: Height after scaling is completed
980        """
981        self.image = pygame.transform.scale(self.image, (width, height))
982        loc = self.rect.topleft
983        self.rect = self.image.get_rect()
984        self.rect.topleft = loc
985
986    def get_rect(self) -> pygame.Rect:
987        """Get the rectangle of the image"""
988        return self.rect
989
990    def draw(self):
991        """Draw the image"""
992        if self.hidden:
993            return
994        self.screen.blit(self.image, self.rect)

1119        self.__next_field_on_tab = None
1120        self.key_is_repeating = False
1121        self.repeating_key = None
1122
1123        # Get the height of the field by getting the size of the font
1124        self.height = self.font.get_height()
1125        # Set the rect of the __text image
1126        self.image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1127        self.rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1128        # Set the rect of the __focus highlight rectangle (when the __text has been clicked on and has __focus)
1129        self.__focused_image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0] - 3, self.loc[1] - 3, self.width + 6, self.height + 6)
1130
1131        # Cursor related things:
1132        self.cursor_surface = pygame.Surface((1, self.height))
1133        self.cursor_surface.fill(self.__text_color)
1134        self.cursor_position = len(self.__text)  # put the cursor at the end of the initial __text
1135        self.__cursor_visible = False
1136        self.__cursor_switch_ms = 500  # Blink every half-second
1137        self.__cursor_ms_counter = 0
1138        # this is a list because element 0 will change as the user edits
1139        self.__cursor_loc = [self.loc[0], self.loc[1]]
1140        self.clock = pygame.time.Clock()
1141
1142        # Create one surface, blit the __text into it during _update_image
1143        # Special flags are needed to set the background alpha as transparent
1144        self.__text_image = pygame.Surface((self.width, self.height), flags=pygame.SRCALPHA)
1145
1146        self._update_image()  # create the image of the starting __text
1147
1148    def _update_image(self):
1149        """
1150        Internal method to render __text as an image.
1151        This method shouldn't be accessed, it's not an interface, it's an implementation.
1152        """
1153        if self.__background_color is not None:
1154            self.__text_image.fill(self.__background_color)
1155
1156        # Render the __text as a single line, and blit it onto the __text_image surface
1157        if self.mask is None:
1158            line_surface = self.font.render(self.__text, True, self.__text_color)
1159        else:
1160            n_chars = len(self.__text)
1161            masked_text = self.mask * n_chars
1162            line_surface = self.font.render(masked_text, True, self.__text_color)
1163        self.__text_image.blit(line_surface, (0, 0))
1164
1165    def update(self, event: pygame.event.EventType) -> bool:
1166        """
1167        Update the InputBox
1168
1169        Args:
1170            event: Events passed in the event loop
1171
1172        Returns:
1173            bool: Whether it is in a click status
1174        """
1175        if not self.is_enabled:
1176            return False
1177        if self.hidden:
1178            return False
1179
1180        if (event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN) and (event.button == 1):  # user clicked
1181            the_x, the_y = event.pos
1182
1183            if self.image_rect.collidepoint(the_x, the_y):
1184                if not self.__focus:
1185                    self.__focus = True  # give this field __focus
1186                    pygame.key.set_repeat(InputText.KEY_REPEAT_DELAY, InputText.KEY_REPEAT_RATE)
1187                else:
1188                    # Field already has __focus, must position the cursor where the user clicked
1189                    n_pixels_from_left = the_x - self.loc[0]
1190                    n_chars = len(self.__text)
1191
1192                    last_char_offset = self.font.size(self.__text)[0]
1193                    if n_pixels_from_left >= last_char_offset:
1194                        self.cursor_position = n_chars
1195                    else:
1196                        for this_char_num in range(0, n_chars):
1197                            this_char_offset = self.font.size(self.__text[:this_char_num])[0]
1198                            if this_char_offset >= n_pixels_from_left:
1199                                self.cursor_position = this_char_num  # Found the proper position for the cursor
1200                                break
1201                    self.__cursor_visible = True  # Show the cursor at the click point
1202
1203            else:
1204                self.__focus = False
1205            return False  # means:  handled click, nothing for client to do
1206
1207        if not self.__focus:  # if this field does not have __focus, don't do anything
1208            return False
1209
1210        if event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
1211            current_key = event.key
1212
1213            if current_key in (pygame.K_RETURN, pygame.K_KP_ENTER):
1214                self.__focus = self.__keep_focus_on_submit  # defaults to False - lose __focus with Enter/Return
1215                if not self.__focus:
1216                    pygame.key.set_repeat(0)  # turn off repeating characters
1217                self._update_image()
1218
1219                if self.command is not None:
1220                    self.command(*self.args)
1221
1222                # User is done typing, return True to signal that __text is available (via a call to get_value)
1223                return True
1224
1225            elif current_key == InputText.CANCELLED_TAB:
1226                # See code below setting up CANCELLED_TAB
1227                # If we get a CANCELLED_TAB as the current key, ignore it, already shifted __focus
1228                pass
1229
1230            elif current_key == pygame.K_BACKSPACE:
1231                self.__text = self.__text[: max(self.cursor_position - 1, 0)] + self.__text[self.cursor_position :]
1232
1233                # Subtract one from cursor_pos, but do not go below zero:
1234                self.cursor_position = max(self.cursor_position - 1, 0)
1235                self._update_image()
1236
1237            elif current_key == pygame.K_DELETE:  # forward delete key
1238                self.__text = self.__text[: self.cursor_position] + self.__text[self.cursor_position + 1 :]
1239                self._update_image()
1240
1241            elif current_key == pygame.K_RIGHT:
1242                if self.cursor_position < len(self.__text):
1243                    self.cursor_position += 1
1244
1245            elif current_key == pygame.K_LEFT:
1246                if self.cursor_position > 0:
1247                    self.cursor_position -= 1
1248
1249            elif current_key == pygame.K_END:
1250                self.cursor_position = len(self.__text)
1251
1252            elif current_key == pygame.K_HOME:
1253                self.cursor_position = 0
1254
1255            elif current_key in (pygame.K_UP, pygame.K_DOWN):
1256                pass
1257
1258            elif current_key == pygame.K_TAB:
1259                if self.__next_field_on_tab is not None:  # Move __focus to a different field
1260                    self.remove_focus()
1261                    self.__next_field_on_tab.give_focus()
1262
1263                    # The TAB key is sent to all fields.  If this field is *before* the field
1264                    # gaining __focus, we cannot send the TAB to that field
1265                    # So, we change the key to something that will be ignored when it is
1266                    # received in the target field
1267                    event.key = InputText.CANCELLED_TAB
1268
1269            else:  # standard key
1270                # If no special key is pressed, add unicode of key to input_string
1271                unicode_of_key = event.unicode  # remember for potential repeating key
1272                self.__text = self.__text[: self.cursor_position] + unicode_of_key + self.__text[self.cursor_position :]
1273                self.cursor_position += len(unicode_of_key)
1274                self._update_image()
1275
1276        return False  # means: handled key, nothing for client code to do
1277
1278    def draw(self):
1279        """Draws the Text in the screen."""
1280        if self.hidden:
1281            return
1282
1283        # If this input __text has __focus, draw an outline around the __text image
1284        if self.__focus:
1285            pygame.draw.rect(self.screen, self.__focus_color, self.__focused_image_rect, 1)
1286
1287        # Blit in the image of __text (set earlier in _update_image)
1288        self.screen.blit(self.__text_image, self.loc)
1289
1290        # If this field has __focus, see if it is time to blink the cursor
1291        if self.__focus:
1292            self.__cursor_ms_counter += self.clock.get_time()
1293            if self.__cursor_ms_counter >= self.__cursor_switch_ms:
1294                self.__cursor_ms_counter %= self.__cursor_switch_ms
1295                self.__cursor_visible = not self.__cursor_visible
1296
1297            if self.__cursor_visible:
1298                cursor_offset = self.font.size(self.__text[: self.cursor_position])[0]
1299                if self.cursor_position > 0:  # Try to get between characters
1300                    cursor_offset -= 1
1301                if cursor_offset < self.width:  # if the loc is within the __text area, draw it
1302                    self.__cursor_loc[0] = self.loc[0] + cursor_offset
1303                    self.screen.blit(self.cursor_surface, self.__cursor_loc)
1304
1305            self.clock.tick()
1306

1321        self._update_image()

1325        Returns:

1331        """
1332        Clear the text in the field
1333
1334        Args:

1339        self._update_image()

1342        self.__focus = False
1343
1344    def give_focus(self):
1345        """
1346        Give focus to this field
1347        Make sure focus is removed from any previous field before calling this
1348        """
1349        self.__focus = True

1352        """
1353        Args:

1360        """
1361        set position
1362
1363        Args
1364            loc: Coordinates on the screen coordinate system
1365        """
1366        self.loc = loc
1367        self.rect[0] = self.loc[0]
1368        self.rect[1] = self.loc[1]
1369
1370        self.image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1371        self.rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0], self.loc[1], self.width, self.height)
1372        # Set the rect of the __focus highlight rectangle (when the __text has been clicked on and has __focus)
1373        self.__focused_image_rect = pygame.Rect(self.loc[0] - 3, self.loc[1] - 3, self.width + 6, self.height + 6)
1374        # this is a list because element 0 will change as the user edits
1375        self.__cursor_loc = [self.loc[0], self.loc[1]]

class InputTextConfig(BaseConfig): 
230class InputTextConfig(BaseConfig):
231    """
232    This is the configuration class for the CheckBox class. It includes the following configuration options
233
234    Attributes:
235        -loc (tuple): This property indicates the initial top-left position of the text box component.It is represented by
236         a tuple and defaults to (0, 0).
237        -new_color (tuple): This property represents the background new_color of the text box.It is represented as an RGB
238         tuple and defaults to (0, 0, 0).
239        -text_color (tuple): This property is the new_color of the text in the text box.It is represented as an RGB tuple
240         and defaults to (2255, 255, 255).
241        -font (str): This property represents the name of the text font in string format and defaults to None, which is the
242         system default font
243        -value (str): This property represents the text in the initial state and defaults to.
244        -width (int): This property is the length of the text box in pixels.It defaults to 250
245        -font_size (int): This property represents the font size and also determines the height of the text box.It defaults
246         to 30
247        - focus_color(tuple): This property refers to the new_color of the outer border of the text box while it is
248         selected, defaults to (0, 0, 0).
249        -init_focus (bool): This property indicates whether the text box gets focus directly when initialized and defaults
250         to False
251        -mask (str): This property indicates the character in which the input should be rendered in the text field
252         (* if it's a password field).It defaults to None, which means no mask is used
253        - keep_focus_on_submit(bool): This property indicates whether to keep focus when the Enter or Return key is pressed
254         in a text box. It defaults to False
255        -command (function): This is the function you want to call when the Enter or Return key is pressed in the text box.
256         It defaults to None, indicating that no function was called
257        -args (tuple): This is a tuple representing the arguments of the command
258    """
259
260    def __init__(self, screen):
261        super().__init__(screen)
262        self.loc = (0, 0)
263        self.color = (255, 255, 255)
264        self.text_color = (0, 0, 0)
265        self.font = None
266        self.value = ""
267        self.width = 250
268        self.font_size = 30
269        self.command = None
270        self.args = tuple
271        self.focus_color = (0, 0, 0)
272        self.init_focus = False
273        self.mask = None
274        self.keep_focus_on_submit = False

This is the configuration class for the CheckBox class. It includes the following configuration options

Attributes: -loc (tuple): This property indicates the initial top-left position of the text box component.It is represented by a tuple and defaults to (0, 0). -new_color (tuple): This property represents the background new_color of the text box.It is represented as an RGB tuple and defaults to (0, 0, 0). -text_color (tuple): This property is the new_color of the text in the text box.It is represented as an RGB tuple and defaults to (2255, 255, 255). -font (str): This property represents the name of the text font in string format and defaults to None, which is the system default font -value (str): This property represents the text in the initial state and defaults to. -width (int): This property is the length of the text box in pixels.It defaults to 250 -font_size (int): This property represents the font size and also determines the height of the text box.It defaults to 30 - focus_color(tuple): This property refers to the new_color of the outer border of the text box while it is selected, defaults to (0, 0, 0). -init_focus (bool): This property indicates whether the text box gets focus directly when initialized and defaults to False -mask (str): This property indicates the character in which the input should be rendered in the text field (* if it's a password field).It defaults to None, which means no mask is used - keep_focus_on_submit(bool): This property indicates whether to keep focus when the Enter or Return key is pressed in a text box. It defaults to False -command (function): This is the function you want to call when the Enter or Return key is pressed in the text box. It defaults to None, indicating that no function was called -args (tuple): This is a tuple representing the arguments of the command

class RadioButtons: 
 997class RadioButtons:
 998    """
 999    Set of radio boxes based on checkboxes
1000    Args:
1001        screen (pghelper.Surface): The surface of the scene to be drawn
1002        buttons (list[CheckBox]): A list of CheckBox instances
1003    """
1004
1005    def __init__(self, screen: pygame.Surface, buttons: list[CheckBox]):
1006        self.screen = screen
1007        self.buttons = buttons
1008        self._last_button = None
1009
1010    def update(self, event):
1011        """
1012        Update Radio boxes
1013
1014        Args:
1015            event: Events passed in the event loop
1016        """
1017        for button in self.buttons:
1018            _event = pygame.event.Event(pygame.KEYDOWN)
1019            button.update(_event)
1020        if event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
1021            for button in self.buttons:
1022                if button.rect.collidepoint(pygame.mouse.get_pos()) and not button.is_check:
1023                    button.is_check = True
1024                    button.image = button.on_down_image
1025                    if self._last_button is not None:
1026                        self._last_button.is_check = False
1027                    self._last_button = button
1028                    break
1029
1030    def get_focus(self) -> int | None:
1031        """Returns which radio box is selected"""
1032        for i in range(len(self.buttons)):
1033            if self.buttons[i].image == self.buttons[i].on_down_image:
1034                return i
1035            if self.buttons[i].image == self.buttons[i].off_down_image:
1036                return i
1037        return None
1038
1039    def draw(self):
1040        """Draw Radio boxes"""
1041        for button in self.buttons:
1042            button.draw()
